paragraph.paragraph: The Building property page in the Configuration Properties folder contains the following properties:

Root Class
The name of the class that contains the Creation Routine. For library projects specifying a root, this class will be used to determine all reachable classes. For more information on project general.xmlinclude_all_classesInclude All Classes see the general.xmlGeneral Properties.

Creation Routine
The name of the routine, in the build.xmlroot_classRoot Class, that is called on application startup. This option is only used for non-library based projects. For more information on project general.xmlinclude_all_classesInclude All Classes see the general.xmlGeneral Properties.

Debug Clauses
A semi-colon (;) delimited list of ../../../compiling_projects/debug_clauses.xmlDebug Clauses to conditional compile sections of code with your project.
Clicking on the ellipse (...) button will display the edit_command_dialog.xmlEdit Debug Clauses dialog where you can enter debug clauses graphically.

Optimize Code
Instructs the compiler to discard incremental compilation information and generate a single assembly module. Based on other property settings assertions.xmlAssertion Properties may be discarded and code size reduced.

CLS Compliant
Specifies if the project is CLS-Compliant. For information on write CLS-Complaint code, see ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/cpguide/html/cpconwritingcls-compliantcode.htmWritting CLS Compliant Code.

IL Verifiable
Specifies if the project output can be verified by tools such as PeVerify.exe

Classes per Module
The number of Eiffel classes to place in a single incremental assembly module. The lower the number the fast compilation will be, but incurs a slower startup time. The larger the number the slower compilation will be, but results a faster start up. This property is only available when not optimizing code by setting the build.xmloptimize_codeOptimize Code property.

Suppress Compiler Warnings
Blocks the compiler's ability to generate compile-time warnings. Other build related warnings will not be suppressed.

Output Path
Specifies the path to copy any built output to, on a successful build.

Compile Unmanaged Library
Indicates the compilation should also compile any unmanaged portion of code generated by the Eiffel compiler. If your project does not call out to any unmanaged code, such as the Windows API, there is no need to compile the unmanaged code. See the ../../../compiling_projects/unmanaged_code.xmlUnmanaged Code section of the documentation for more information.

Register for COM Interop
Indicates that your managed application will expose a COM object (a COM-callable wrapper) that allows a COM object to interact with your managed application. The general.xmloutput_typeOutput Type property of this application must be Class Library in order for the Register for COM Interop property to be available. For more information, see general.xmlGeneral Properties.
